frontend.title: KVM frontend (web socket)
frontend.description: Front end used to provide VNC.

frontend-instance-guid.title: Frontend Instance ID
frontend-instance-guid.description: Unique identifier of the frontend instance, like "SOFTINST-11031".

frontend-software-type.title: Frontend Software Type
frontend-software-type.description: Type of the frontend instance, like "frontend".

frontend-software-url.title: Frontend Software URL
frontend-software-url.description: Software Release URL of the frontend instance, like "http://example.com/path/to/software.cfg".

slave-frontend.title: Web frontend
slave-frontend.description: Front end used to provide web access for internal services at the kvm.

instance-guid.title: Main Frontend Instance ID
instance-guid.description: Unique identifier of the frontend instance, like "SOFTINST-11031".

frontend-software-type.title: Frontend Software Type
frontend-software-type.description: Type of the frontend instance, like "frontend".

frontend-software-url.title: Frontend Software URL
frontend-software-url.description: Software Release URL of the frontend instance, like "http://example.com/path/to/software.cfg".

domain.title: Name of the domain to be used
domain.description: Name of the domain to be used (example: mydomain.com). Subdomains of this domain will be used for the slave instances (example: instance12345.mydomain.com).

url.title: URL of backend to use.
url.description: URL of backend to use. This URL will be used to request frontend if parameter 'kvm-partition-name' is not set.

enable-cache.title: Use cache for this slave frontend.
enable-cache.description: Specify if slave frontend should use a squid to connect to backend.

type.title: Specify if slave frontend will redirect to a zope backend.
type.description: If specified, Apache RewriteRule will use Zope's Virtual Host Daemon. Possible values: 'zope', 'default'.

zope-path.title: Path to the VirtualHostRoot of the zope.
zope-path.description: Only used if type is 'zope'. Will append the specified path to the VirtualHostRoot of the zope's VirtualHostMonster.

https-only.title: Access website with https url only.
https-only.description: Specify if website should be accessed using https only. If so, the frontend will redirect the user to https if accessed from http.

kvm-partition-name.title: Reference name in kvm instance definition to get url from.
kvm-partition-name.description: Compose url from kvm definition. Only work if 'use-nat' is true and 'service-port' is set. This will allow to get URL from defined nat-rules. Play the same as url, but help if you don't know kvm ipv6 yet.

service-port.title: Port of service into the VM (require: kvm-name).
service-port.description: This will allow to get URL from defined nat-rules. The port should exist in nat-rules of KVM you have referenced by 'kvm-partition-name'

url-scheme.title: Scheme of HTTP service into the VM (require: kvm-name).
url-scheme.description: Say If HTTP service to run/or running into the Virtual Machine will use http or https. Possible values: http, https.

fw-restricted-access.title: Restrict all access to VM with firewall.
fw-restricted-access.description: When Firewall is enabled, this parameter define if only vm of this cluster and authorized sources ip should have access to cluster.

fw-authorized-sources.title: List of IP/Network address authorized to cluster.
fw-authorized-sources.description: When Firewall is enabled, this contain the list of IP address to authorize for access to all VM of this cluster.

fw-reject-sources.title: List of IP/Network address rejected, if 'Restrict all access' is off.
fw-reject-sources.description: When Firewall is enabled, this contain the list of IP address which should not access to all VM of this cluster.

authorized-keys.title: Public keys for virtual machines.
authorized-keys.description: Set the list of public keys to add in your virtual machine. The public key file will be available in the VM via url http://10.0.2.100/authorized_keys if you keep the NAT interface enabled

bootstrap-script-url.title: Virtual Machines bootstrap script URL.
bootstrap-script-url.description: If dedicaced disk image is used, this script will be downloaded and run at first boot of the virtual machine. Set md5sum to URL like: http://example.com/file#MD5SUM. Get file in vm at http://10.0.2.100/vm-bootstrap.

cluster-data.title: Text content to share with virtual machines.
cluster-data.description: Text content which will be written in a file data of cluster http server. All VM will be able to download that file via the static URL of cluster HTTP server: https://10.0.2.101/FOLDER_HASH/data.

enable-monitor.title: Enable Monitoring on this cluster
enable-monitor.description: Deploy monitor instance to this kvm instance. It help to check instance status, log and promise results.

monitor-interface-url.title: Monitor Web Interface URL
monitor-interface-url.description: Give Url of HTML web interface that will be used to render this monitor instance.

monitor-cors-domains.title: Monitor CORS domains
monitor-cors-domains.description: List of cors domains separated with space. Needed for ajax query on this monitor instance from a different domain.

computer-guid.title: ID of the computer where to deploy this VM.
computer-guid.description: Unique identifier of the computer, like "COMP-1234". By default, let Master choose a computer.

state.title: State of this Virtual Machine
state.description: Define if SlapOS should start or stop this VM.

auto-ballooning.title: Enable qemu auto ballooning.
auto-ballooning.description: Enable virtio balloon device to allows KVM guests to reduce/re-increase their memory size.

disk-cache.title: Cache option to use with Disk.
disk-cache.description: Disk cache controls how the host cache is used to access block data.

disk-aio.title: Disk aio to use.
disk-aio.description: Selects between pthread based disk I/O and native Linux AIO.

cpu-options.title: CPU Additional options: cores, threads, sockets, maxcpus.
cpu-options.description: Additional options to use with cpu-count. Options are separated by coma: [cores=cores][,threads=threads][,sockets=sockets][,maxcpus=maxcpus]. Set this option if you know what you're doing.

numa.title: Simulate a multi node NUMA system.
numa.description: Simulate a multi node NUMA system. If mem and cpus are omitted, resources are split equally. Each numa option are separated by space: node,nodeid=4,cpus=40-49,mem=64g node,nodeid=1,cpus=10-19,mem=128g. Set this option if you know what you're doing.

machine-options.title: Machine options.
machine-options.description: Select the emulated machine by name. Ex: pc-i440fx-2.4,accel=kvm

cpu-model.title: CPU model.
cpu-model.description: Select the emulated CPU model. Ex: SandyBridge,+erms,+smep,+smx,+vmx

keyboard-layout-language.title: Use keyboard layout language
keyboard-layout-language.description: Use keyboard layout language (for example fr for French). Can be usefull with VNC display

nbd-host.title: NBD hostname or IP
nbd-host.description: hostname (or IP) of the NBD server containing the boot image.

nbd-port.title: NBD port
nbd-port.description: Port of the NBD server containing the boot image.

virtual-hard-drive-url.title: Existing disk image URL
virtual-hard-drive-url.description: If specified, will download an existing disk image (qcow2, raw, ...), and will use it as main virtual hard drive. Can be used to download and use an already installed and customized virtual hard drive.

virtual-hard-drive-md5sum.title: Checksum of virtual hard drive
virtual-hard-drive-md5sum.description: MD5 checksum of virtual hard drive, used if virtual-hard-drive-url is specified.

virtual-hard-drive-gzipped.title: Virtual hard drive to download is gzipped
virtual-hard-drive-gzipped.description: Define if virtual hard drive to download is gzipped using gzip. This help to reduce size of file to download.

hard-drive-url-check-certificate.title: Check certificate when downloading virtual hard drive from https.
hard-drive-url-check-certificate.description: Define if certificate should be checked when downloading virtual hard drive from https url.

external-disk-number.title: Number of additional disk to create for virtual machine
external-disk-number.description: Specify the number of additional disk to create for virtual machine in data folder of SlapOS Node. Requires instance_storage_home to be configured on SlapOS Node.

external-disk-size.title: Size of additional disk to create for virtual machine, in Gigabytes
external-disk-size.description: Specify the size of additional disk to create for virtual machine in data folder of SlapOS Node. Requires instance_storage_home to be configured on SlapOS Node.

external-disk-format.title: Type of external disk drive to create by QEMU.
external-disk-format.description: Type of QEMU disk drive, to create.

use-tap.title: Enable QEMU TAP network interface
use-tap.description: Use QEMU TAP network interface, might require a bridge on SlapOS Node.

nat-rules.title: List of rules for NAT of QEMU user mode network stack.
nat-rules.description: List of rules for NAT of QEMU user mode network stack, as comma-separated list of ports. For each port specified, it will redirect port x of the VM (example: 80) to the port x + 10000 of the public IPv6 (example: 10080). Defaults to "22 80 443".

nat-restrict-mode.title: Isolate the NAT Interface (No Internet access)
nat-restrict-mode.description: If this option is enabled, the NAT interface will be isolated, i.e. it will not be able to contact the host and no guest IP packets will be routed over the host to the outside. This option does not affect any explicitly set nat rules.

enable-vhost.title: Use vhost-net to improve network performance of tap interface
enable-vhost.description: The vhost-net provides much improved network performance for your VM. Only work if the vhost-net kernel module is loaded and available on host machine, please keep this option off if you're not shure.

bootstrap-script-url.title: VM bootstrap script URL.
bootstrap-script-url.description: If dedicaced disk image is used, this script will be downloaded and run at first boot of the virtual machine. Set md5sum to URL like: http://example.com/file#MD5SUM. Get file in vm at http://10.0.2.100/vm-bootstrap.

data-to-vm.title: Text content to send to this virtual machine.
data-to-vm.description: Text content which will be written in a file 'data' of http server of this virtual machine instance. The file will be available via URL: http://10.0.2.100/data in the VM.

disable-ansible-promise.title: Desactivate Ansible promise check
disable-ansible-promise.description: If the VM of cluster doesn't run Ansible and report status to this SlapOS instances, then this allow to disable ansible promise so your instance will not fail to check ansible promise.
